org.apache.tephra.hbase.txprune

Class DataJanitorState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tephra.hbase.txprune.DataJanitorState

  • public class DataJanitorState
extends Object
    Persist data janitor state into an HBase table. This is used by both TransactionProcessor and by the HBaseTransactionPruningPlugin to persist and read the compaction state.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DataJanitorState.TableSupplier
      Supplies table for persisting state

    • Method Detail

      • savePruneUpperBoundForRegion

        public void savePruneUpperBoundForRegion(byte[] regionId,
                                         long pruneUpperBound)
                                  throws IOException
        Persist the latest prune upper bound for a given region. This is called by TransactionProcessor after major compaction.
        Parameters:
        regionId - region id
        pruneUpperBound - the latest prune upper bound for the region
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to persist the data to HBase

      • getPruneUpperBoundForRegion

        public long getPruneUpperBoundForRegion(byte[] regionId)
                                 throws IOException
        Get latest prune upper bound for a given region. This indicates the largest invalid transaction that no longer has writes in this region.
        Parameters:
        regionId - region id
        Returns:
        latest prune upper bound for the region
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to read the data from HBase

      • getPruneInfoForRegion

        @Nullable
public RegionPruneInfo getPruneInfoForRegion(byte[] regionId)
                                                throws IOException
        Get the latest RegionPruneInfo for a given region.
        Parameters:
        regionId - region id
        Returns:
        RegionPruneInfo for the region
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to read the data from HBase

      • getPruneUpperBoundForRegions

        public Map<byte[],Long> getPruneUpperBoundForRegions(SortedSet<byte[]> regions)
                                              throws IOException
        Get latest prune upper bounds for given regions. This is a batch operation of method getPruneUpperBoundForRegion(byte[])
        Parameters:
        regions - a set of regions
        Returns:
        a map containing region id and its latest prune upper bound value
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to read the data from HBase

      • getPruneInfoForRegions

        public List<RegionPruneInfo> getPruneInfoForRegions(@Nullable
                                                    SortedSet<byte[]> regions)
                                             throws IOException
        Gets a list of RegionPruneInfo for given regions. Returns all regions if the given regions set is null.
        Parameters:
        regions - a set of regions
        Returns:
        list of RegionPruneInfos.
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to read the data from HBase

      • deletePruneUpperBounds

        public void deletePruneUpperBounds(long deletionPruneUpperBound,
                                   SortedSet<byte[]> excludeRegions)
                            throws IOException
        Delete prune upper bounds for the regions that are not in the given exclude set, and the prune upper bound is less than the given value. After the invalid list is pruned up to deletionPruneUpperBound, we do not need entries for regions that have prune upper bound less than deletionPruneUpperBound. We however limit the deletion to only regions that are no longer in existence (due to deletion, etc.), to avoid update/delete race conditions.
        Parameters:
        deletionPruneUpperBound - prune upper bound below which regions will be deleted
        excludeRegions - set of regions that should not be deleted
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to delete data in HBase

      • saveRegionsForTime

        public void saveRegionsForTime(long time,
                               Set<byte[]> regions)
                        throws IOException
        Persist the regions for the given time. HBaseTransactionPruningPlugin saves the set of transactional regions existing in the HBase instance periodically.
        Parameters:
        time - timestamp in milliseconds
        regions - set of regions at the time
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to persist the data to HBase

      • getRegionsOnOrBeforeTime

        @Nullable
public TimeRegions getRegionsOnOrBeforeTime(long time)
                                               throws IOException
        Return the set of regions saved for the time at or before the given time. This method finds the greatest time that is less than or equal to the given time, and then returns all regions with that exact time, but none that are older than that.
        Parameters:
        time - timestamp in milliseconds
        Returns:
        set of regions and time at which they were recorded, or null if no regions found
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to read the data from HBase

      • deleteAllRegionsOnOrBeforeTime

                                    throws IOException
        Delete all the regions that were recorded for all times equal or less than the given time.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to delete data in HBase

      • saveInactiveTransactionBoundForTime

        public void saveInactiveTransactionBoundForTime(long time,
                                                long inactiveTransactionBound)
                                         throws IOException
        Persist inactive transaction bound for a given time. This is the smallest not in-progress transaction that will not have writes in any HBase regions that are created after the given time.
        Parameters:
        time - time in milliseconds
        inactiveTransactionBound - inactive transaction bound for the given time
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to persist the data to HBase

      • getInactiveTransactionBoundForTime

        public long getInactiveTransactionBoundForTime(long time)
                                        throws IOException
        Return inactive transaction bound for the given time.
        Parameters:
        time - time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        inactive transaction bound for the given time
        Throws:
        IOException - when not able to read the data from HBase

        public SortedSet<byte[]> getEmptyRegionsAfterTime(long time,
                                                  @Nullable
                                                  SortedSet<byte[]> includeRegions)
                                           throws IOException
        Return regions that were recorded as empty after the given time.
        Parameters:
        time - time in milliseconds
        includeRegions - If not null, the returned set will be an intersection of the includeRegions set and the empty regions after the given time
        Throws:
        IOException
